required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Recombinant Human Antithrombin (ATryn®) in the Treatment of Patients With DIC Associated With Severe Sepsis
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Efficacy and Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Dose Finding Study of ATryn® (Antithrombin Alfa) in Patients With Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation Associated With Severe Sepsis

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to explore the efficacy and safety of ATryn® (antithrombin alfa) for the treatment of disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) associated with severe sepsis, when administered by continuous intravenous (IV) infusion over five days.

primary_outcome.measure: Patients Alive on Day 28, Having Had an Improvement in the DIC Score (Overt or Non-overt) by at Least 2 Points Between Baseline and Day 6 and Having Had no Worsening of the SOFA Score Between Baseline and Day 6.
primary_outcome.description: Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (DIC) ranges from 0 to 8 points, the higher the score the worse coagulation/outcome. Sepsis-related Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) is a composite score of scores for the respiratory, cardiovascular, hepatic, coagulation, renal and neurological systems. Each system is scored from 0 to 4 with a higher score given for worse organ function. The scores are then added together to give a total range from 0 to 24 with a higher score representing a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 6 in SOFA Score Among Survivors on Day 6
secondary_outcome.description: Sepsis-related Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) is a composite score of scores for the respiratory, cardiovascular, hepatic, coagulation, renal and neurological systems. Each system is scored from 0 to 4 with a higher score given for worse organ function. The scores are then added together to give a total range from 0 to 24 with a higher score representing a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 6 in DIC Score Among Survivors on Day 6
secondary_outcome.description: Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (DIC) ranges from 0 to 8 points, the higher the score the worse coagulation/outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Days Alive and Out of ICU Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Days alive and out of ICU at day 28 for all patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Days Alive and Out of Hospital Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Days alive and out of Hospital at day 28 for all patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Days Alive and Free of Inotrope/Vasopressor Support Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Days alive and free of inotrope/vasopressor at day 28 for all patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Days Alive and Off Ventilator Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Days alive and free of mechanical ventilation at day 28 for all patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Days Alive and Free of Need for Renal Replacement Therapy Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Days alive and out of renal replacement therapy at day 28 for all patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 6 in Inflammation Marker IL-6
Change From Baseline to Day 6 in Inflammation Marker Procalcitonin

arm_group.description: Loading dose followed by maintenance IV infusion for 5 days to maintain antithrombin activity at the target level 125-175%
Loading dose followed by maintenance IV infusion for 5 days to maintain antithrombin activity at the target level 225-275%
The best standard treatment for the underlying condition only

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent has been obtained from the patient or his/her legally acceptable representative
- Severe sepsis
- Disseminated intravascular coagulation

group.title: AT-150
group.description: Loading dose followed by maintenance IV infusion for 5 days to maintain antithrombin activity at the target level 125-175% antithrombin alfa (INN name)

group.title: AT-250
group.description: Loading dose followed by maintenance IV infusion for 5 days to maintain antithrombin activity at the target level 225-275% antithrombin alfa (INN name)

group.title: Control
group.description: The best standard treatment for the underlying condition only Control

reported_events.desc: In this study Critical events were defined to include major bleedings, thromboembolic complications and deaths and are reported as 'Serious Adverse Events'. All other adverse events were collected and reported together as 'Other (not including Serious) Adverse Events'.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: LEO Pharma A/S seeks publication of all clinical trials in peer-reviewed journals regardless of whether the findings are positive or negative, and acknowledges the investigators' right to publish results irrespective of outcome. Investigators are permitted to publish their individual data with the prior review and consent of LEO Pharma A/S
